title: automotive font
content:
hey guys stuck on another one. any ideas? thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022114542im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nation_3971.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [nation.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022114542/http:/typophile.com/files/nation_1.jpg) | 12.92 KB |
author: snipa21

comments.content: well, no "match" per se, but you could probably take something like [Teuton Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022114542/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/teuton/) or [Metral Extra Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022114542/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/northernblock/metral/) and modify from there.
thank you. I appreciate the help. I believe it is the font used for Toyota Camry. I believe it may not even be an actual font, more likely created as artwork.

Not the Camry logo at all. The only common element is the open delta-shaped 'A'. The Camry logo has serif-ey swashes at the top of the A and the other four letters. [Camry Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20141022114542/http:/www.logoeps.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/toyota-camry-logo-vector-01.png).
